abstract: MySpace is regarded as one of Rupert Murdoch’s savviest buys, but it’s light is dimming as it falls behind fast-growing Facebook.
snippet: MySpace is regarded as one of Rupert Murdoch’s savviest buys, but it’s light is dimming as it falls behind fast-growing Facebook.
lead_paragraph: MySpace is regarded as one of Rupert Murdoch’s savviest buys. But the likelihood that the site, owned by the News Corporation, will renew its lucrative advertising contract with Google is dimming as it falls behind fast-growing Facebook. That explains why a MySpace co-founder was replaced by a former Facebook executive last week.

headline.main: Shine of MySpace May Fade a Bit
headline.print_headline: Shine of MySpace May Fade a Bit

byline.original: By Lauren Silva Laughlin, Rob Cox and Jeff Segal

abstract: Heirs to John Steinbeck raise concerns about the Google books settlement and seek to delay its approval.
snippet: Heirs to John Steinbeck raise concerns about the Google books settlement and seek to delay its approval.
lead_paragraph: UPDATE 1:35 PM Adds reference to postponement request by Google, authors and publishers.

headline.main: Steinbeck Heirs Seek to Slow Google Books Settlement

abstract: MySpace is regarded as one of Rupert Murdoch’s savviest buys. But the likelihood that the site, owned by the News Corporation, will renew its lucrative advertising contract with Google is dimming as it falls behind fast-growing Facebook, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: MySpace is regarded as one of Rupert Murdoch’s savviest buys. But the likelihood that the site, owned by the News Corporation, will renew its lucrative advertising contract with Google is dimming as it falls behind fast-growing Facebook, Breakingviews says.

headline.main: Murdoch’s MySpace Deal May Lose Some Shine
